article.headline: UT-Chattanooga 65, Davidson 59
article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. (AP) -- Jerice Crouch had a career-high 23 points to lead Chattanooga to a 65-59 win over Davidson on Monday night. The Mocs (12-9, 3-3 Southern Conference) built a 12-point lead with 6:17 remaining in the game. Davidson (11-8, 5-2) answered with a 7-1 run to cut the margin to six at 53-47 with 2:58 left. Matt McKillop's 3-pointer with 9 seconds left got the Wildcats within two, but Crouch, who shot 13-of-18 from the line, made four straight free throws in the final 4 seconds to seal the win for the Mocs. Keddric Mays and Steve Cherry each had 10 points for Chattanooga. Ricky Hood grabbed nine rebounds. Brendan Winters was the only Wildcat in double digits with 24 points, while McKillop had 9. Winters and Thomas Sander both had eight rebounds, and Boris Meno grabbed nine. Davidson struggled with fouls, committing 29 to the Mocs' 15, with Meno, Ian Johnson and Kenny Grant fouling out. Chattanooga made 25-of-39 from the free throw line, while Davidson hit 6-of-9. The Monday game was the first for the Mocs without Alphonso Pugh, who will miss the rest of the season with a knee injury he suffered during Saturday's 77-67 win over Austin Peay.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
